cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi SE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving slowly north-northwest, expected to bend northwest then north and skirt/come ashore along the South-North Carolina border area before turning northward inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just north of Myrtle Beach, SC (close to the SC/NC state line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire South Carolina coast and southeastern North Carolina coast within the forecast cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Saturday night into Sunday at the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft above ground level around times of high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain with locally higher amounts, producing periods of heavy rainfall
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents affecting vessel approaches and pilot boarding areas
